td.content: s:34 YO white f hotel attendant presents with mild vomiting. she also reports severe headache, moderate nausea, Traumatic Injury - Blunt associated with the mild vomiting. a short time ago she sustained a blow to the back of the head (52 min LOC) o:Height 157 cm, Weight 47.3 kg, Temperature 37 C, Pulse 82, SystolicBP 110, DiastolicBP 72, Respiration 16, CT Head (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB, MRI Brain Unremarkable, appears in NAD, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Chest = normal breathing sounds B/L, Neuro: WNL, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex a:TBI (concussion) p:administered Flexeril - 10 mg po q 8 hrs PRN pain/cramps, performed CT Head, MRI Brain, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed, and ordered rest, and referred patient to family practice/primary care.

, CT Head ( - ) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive

td.content: s:white female hotel attendant aged 34 yrs presents for 6 days f/u after sustaining a mild concussion (LOC 52 min). she denies nausea, headache and vomiting since the accident. she has had no subsequent loss of consciousness (LOC). she has resumed usual state of function. she consumes 2 drinks per night Patient does not smoke o:Height 157 cm, Weight 47.9 kg, Temperature 37 C, Pulse 82, SystolicBP 113, DiastolicBP 76, Respiration 17, MRI Brain Unremarkable, HEENT: NCAT, PERRL, Neck: Supple, C/V: RRR, Pulm: CTAB. Good effort, Abd: Scaphoid, soft, ND, NTTP. BS WNL, MS: Extremities x 4 WNL. Strength 5/5, equal bilaterally, Neuro: CN II-XII WNL. No deficits, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex a:S/P Concussion (with loss of consciousness from 31 to 59 minutes). No sequelae p:performed MRI Brain, and performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed.

content2.Unmatched: per night Patient does not smoke

content2.Unmatched: No deficits , Eyes = normal pupillary reflex
